post_text:
BASIS Charter Schools Re-Opening and Distance Learning Plan

As you know, our educators and our school's faculty, staff, and administrators have been working diligently to prepare for what will be an unprecedented academic year. However, we are ready for anything! We are ready for our students to learn on-campus (if that is possible given the national, state, and local circumstances), and we are ready for our students to learn via our distance learning program. Please find the BASIS Charter Schools Re-Opening and Distance Learning Plan for the 2020-21 school year here: https://tinyurl.com/y7gpvszj

As the summer progresses, we will continue to provide pertinent updates. In the meantime, please consider your choices through our 'Families Choose in 2020-21' program, and let us know if you have any questions. And, of course, please stay safe.

post_text:
BACK TO SCHOOL WITH BASIS CHARTER SCHOOLS

At the beginning of July, we are giving you “sneak peeks” into highlights of our school opening and distance learning plans!

This week, we will release our full 2020-21 School Opening Plan to all BASIS Charter School families. At that time, we'll deliver the details for health and safety changes to facilities and campus protocols for families who choose to send their students back to campus, and also details about the online program and curriculum for students who will opt to participate in distance learning at home -- and remember, you get to decide which is best for your family! At BASIS Charter Schools, Families Choose in 2020-21.

But, for now, our last “sneak peek” into the plan. And check out our page to see Sneak Peeks #1, #2, and #3!

To read more about our Families Choose in 2020-21 plan, please check out: https://tinyurl.com/y7qjkt2p

post_text:
An Update Regarding the 2020-21 School Year in Arizona

Dear BASIS Charter School families in Arizona,

We hope you are safe and well. We would like to provide you with an update regarding the start of the 2020-21 school year. In light of Governor Ducey’s new executive order delaying in-person school instruction until August 17, 2020, BASIS Charter Schools in Arizona plan to begin instruction 100% online on the regularly scheduled first day of school. We plan to return to our 'Families Choose in 2020-21' program, with parents indicating whether they would prefer to have their students receive instruction in-person or via distance learning, as soon as the State permits.

We will continue to provide updates to you over the summer and as guidance from officials evolves. Please continue to enjoy your summer!

Sincerely,
Aaron Kindel
CEO, BASIS.ed

Peter Bezanson
CEO, BASIS Educational Ventures

For more information, please check out: https://tinyurl.com/y7qjkt2p

post_text:
Hi Jags!

Literati Club here.

In past years, Literati has been sold and distributed in physical copies. However, due to COVID-19 and quarantine, we deemed it impossible to do so in a way that was safe and accessible. So, this year's edition of Literati has gone digital! By working on Literati remotely and producing a digital copy, we are also able to reach a wider audience within the BASIS community and beyond.

We'd like to say a big thank you to the administration who supported our ideas, the members who worked on the book, and to everyone who submitted! We hope you enjoy it, and stay safe!

Love,

Literati

To read, visit our website: https://literatibov.wixsite.com/literati

Arizona Gives Day is just around the corner! On April 2, 2019, BASIS Charter Schools will participate in our first AZ Gives Day—a statewide 24-hour online fundraising campaign for nonprofits, just like us!

Each individual BASIS Charter School throughout Arizona will have its own donation page, so all of your contributions will go directly to the Annual Teacher Fund at our school! #AZGivesDay

Posted by BASIS.ed: Arizona Charter Schools Association has released the 2018 Charter Award winners. Drum roll please...
Huge congratulations to Dr. John Rosinbum, AP U.S. History & AP Research teacher at BASIS Tucson North, for winning the 2018 Charter Teacher of the Year! Dr. Rosinbum has taught at BASIS Charter Schools for six years and goes above and beyond to ensure his students are engaged and challenged all while bringing history to life, and his hard work has not gone unnoticed. Congrats again Dr. Rosinbum!

https://azcharters.org/2018-charter-award-winners/
